  "article_text": [
    "let @xmath0 denote a closed , oriented surface of genus @xmath1 , and let @xmath2 denote its mapping class group , which is the group of homotopy classes of orientation - preserving homeomorphisms .",
    "the study of generators of @xmath2 was pioneered by dehn .",
    "dehn [ de ] proved that @xmath2 is generated by a finite set of dehn twists .",
    "lickorish [ li ] showed that @xmath3 dehn twists generate @xmath2 .",
    "this number was improved to @xmath4 by humphries [ hu ] .",
    "humphries proved , moreover , that in fact the number @xmath4 is minimal ; i.e. @xmath2 can not be generated by @xmath5 ( or less ) dehn twists .",
    "it is classical problem to find small generating sets and torsion generating sets for @xmath2 .",
    "maclachlan [ ma ] proved that the moduli space is simply connected as a topological space by showing that @xmath2 is generated by torsion elements .",
    "mccarthy and papadopoulos [ mp ] proved that @xmath2 is generated by infinitely many conjugates of a single involution for @xmath6 .",
    "luo [ luo ] discovered a first finite set of involutions which generate @xmath2 for @xmath6 .",
    "luo posed the question of whether there is a universal upper bound , independent of @xmath1 , for the number of torsion elements needs to generate @xmath2 .",
    "brendle and farb answered luo s question .",
    "brendle and farb [ bf ] proved that @xmath2 is generated by 3 elements of order @xmath7 , @xmath8 and @xmath9 ( or @xmath1 ) .",
    "more , korkmaz [ ko ] showed that @xmath2 is generated by 2 torsion elements , each of order @xmath8 .",
    "brendle and farb [ bf ] also constructed a generating set of @xmath2 for @xmath6 consisting of 6 involutions .",
    "kassabov [ ka ] improved their method to show that @xmath2 is generated by 4 involutions if @xmath10 , 5 involutions if @xmath11 and 6 involutions if @xmath6 .    for all @xmath12 ,",
    "the elements of order 2 , 3 and 4 are in @xmath2 . in the present paper",
    ", we construct a generating set of @xmath2 consisting of elements of small order(@xmath13 ) .    for @xmath6 , @xmath2 can be generated by 3 elements of order 3 and by 4 elements of order 4 .",
    "let @xmath14 be a simple closed curve on @xmath0 . then the ( right hand ) dehn twist @xmath15 about @xmath14 is the homotopy class of the homeomorphism obtained by cutting @xmath0 along @xmath14 , twisting one of the side by @xmath16 to the right and gluing two sides of @xmath14 back to each other .",
    "figure  [ fig1 ] shows the dehn twist about the curve @xmath14 .",
    "we will denote by @xmath15 the dehn twist about the curve @xmath14 .",
    "we recall the following lemmas and theorems .",
    "[ lem1 ] for any homeomorphism @xmath17 of the surface @xmath0 , the dehn twists around the curves @xmath14 and @xmath18 are conjugate in the mapping class group @xmath2 , @xmath19    [ lem2 ] let @xmath14 and @xmath20 be two simple closed curves on @xmath0 . if @xmath14 is disjoint from @xmath20 , then @xmath21    [ lem3 ] if the geometric intersection number of @xmath14 and @xmath20 is one , then @xmath22    we denote the curves @xmath23 , @xmath24 , @xmath25 as shown in figure  [ fig2 ] .",
    "then @xmath2 is generated by @xmath26 .",
    "we call @xmath26 lickorish s generators .",
    "@xmath2 is generated by @xmath27 , @xmath28 , @xmath29 , @xmath30 .",
    "we call @xmath31 humphries s generators .",
    "in this section we prove that the mapping class group @xmath2 is generated by 3 elements of order 3 .",
    "we assume that @xmath6 .",
    "we construct two elements of order 3 by cutting and gluing surfaces .",
    "we take the curves @xmath32 , @xmath33 and the separating curve @xmath34 like figure  [ fig a ] .    ,",
    "@xmath33 , @xmath34,width=264 ]      we assume that @xmath1 is odd .",
    "we construct an element @xmath35 of order 3 .",
    "we cut @xmath0 along the curves @xmath36 and @xmath37 @xmath38 to obtain @xmath39 surfaces @xmath40 , @xmath41 ,  , @xmath42 as shown in figure  [ fig3 ] .",
    "@xmath40 is a sphere with @xmath43 boundary components and @xmath44 @xmath38 is a pair of pants bounded by @xmath37 .",
    "we embed @xmath40 , @xmath41 ,  ,",
    "@xmath42 in @xmath45 so that they are invariant under @xmath46-rotations @xmath47 , @xmath48 ,  , @xmath49 , respectively ( cf . figure  [ fig4 ] ) .",
    "-symmetry of @xmath0,width=226 ]    since the homeomorphisms @xmath47 , @xmath48 ,  , @xmath49 coincide on the boundaries , they naturally define a homeomorphism @xmath50 of order 3 .",

    "the basic idea is to use the _ lantern relation _ which was discovered by dehn and rediscovered by johnson [ jo ] .",

    ". we can now rewrite ( [ eq1 ] ) as @xmath69 and hence @xmath27 is a product of 3 elements of order 3 .",
    "we prove theorem .",

    "since we show that all lickorish s generators are in @xmath70 , @xmath70 is equal to @xmath2 .",
    "in this section we prove that @xmath2 can be generated by 4 elements of order 4 . the key point is to use _",
    "chain relation_.      we prepare to construct 3 elements of order 4 .",

    "in the case of @xmath262 , we note that @xmath2 can not be generated by elements of same order . by using the argument of maccarthy and papadopulos [ mp ] and the work of hirose [ hi ]",
    ", we can see the proof .",
    "hirose listed the dehn twist presentation of finite order elements for closed oriented surfaces of genera up to 4 .",
    "we introduce the presentation of finite order elements in the case of @xmath262 .",
    "the list is as follow : +   +    c||d40.0|d4.0 * genus * & & + 1 & t__1t__1 & 6 + & t__1t__1t__1 & 4 + 2 & t__2t__1t__1t__1 & 10 + & t__2t__2t__1t__1t__1 & 8 + & t__2t__2t__1t__1t__1 & 6 + & ( t__1t__1t__1t__2t__2)(t__2t__2t__1t__1t__1)^3 & 6 +        @xmath265 \\\\ \\ \\ \\ \\ \\rotatebox{90}{$\\in$ } &                  & \\rotatebox{90}{$\\in$ } \\\\[-4pt ] \\\\ \\ \\ \\ \\ \\textit{t}_{\\textit{c } }                      & \\longmapsto      & 1 \\end{array}\\ ] ] we can find that @xmath266 it is easily to see that @xmath267 can not be generated by 0 and 5 .",
    "therefore we can see that @xmath263 can not be generated by elements of order 2 .",
    "99 t. e. brendle and b. farb .",
    "_ every mapping class group is generated by 3 torsion elements and by 6 involutions .",
    "_ j. algebra * 278 * ( 2004 ) , @xmath273 .",
    "_ papers on group theory and topology .",
    "_ springerverlag , new york , 1987 ( die gruppe der abbildungsklassen , acta math",
    "* 69 * ( 1938 ) , @xmath274 ) s. hirose .",
    "_ presentations of periodic maps on oriented closed surfaces of genera up to 4 .",
    "_ osaka journal of mathematics , to appear .",
    "s. p. humphries .",
    "_ generators for the mapping class group .",
    "_ topology of @xmath275 manifolds proc .",
    "second sussex conf .",
    "chelwood gate 1977 , lecture notes in math .",
    "* 722 * ( 1979 ) , springer , @xmath276 .",
    "d. johnson . _",
    "the structure of torelli group i : a finite set of generators for @xmath277 .",
    "_ ann . of math .",
    "* 118 * ( 1983 ) , @xmath278 .",
    "m. kassabov .",
    "_ generating mapping class groups by involutions .",
    "_ arxiv : math.gt/0311455 v1 25 nov 2003 . m. korkmaz .",
    "_ generating the surface mapping class group by two elements . _",
    "* 357 * ( 2005 ) , @xmath279 . w. b. r. lickorish . _ a finite set of generators for the homeotopy group of a 2-manifold . _",
    "cambridge philos .",
    "* 60 * ( 1964 ) , 769778",
    "_ torsion elements in the mapping class group of a surface .",
    "_ arxiv : math.gt/0004048 v1 8 apr 2000 .",
    "c. maclachlan .",
    "_ modulus space is simply - connected .",
    "* 29 * ( 1971 ) , 8586 .",
    "j. maccarthy and a. papadopoulos .",
    "_ involutions in surface mapping class groups .",
    "_ enseign . math . * 33 * ( 1987 ) , 275290 .",
    "j. powell .",
    "_ two theorems on the mapping class group of a surface .",
    "* 68 * ( 1978 ) , no .",
    "3 , 347350 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we show that the mapping class group of a closed oriented surface of genus at least three is generated by 3 elements of order 3 and by 4 elements of order 4 . </S>",
    "<S> note that the mapping class group can not be generated by finitely many torsion elements of same order if genus is equal to one or two . </S>"
  ]
}
